locutie.beschrijving: The sermon explores the concept of 'outreach' as a divine attribute, tracing God's 'reaching out' from Genesis through the Exodus to the Resurrection, linking it to the congregation's mission and social ethics.
locutie.exegetische_kwaliteit: Strong. Connects the transition from 1 Cor 15 (resurrection) to 1 Cor 16 (collection) effectively, grounding ethics in ontology.

illocutie.beschrijving: The preacher primarily asserts the nature of God's history and explains the theological basis for mission, with occasional moments of promising and commanding.
voorbeelden: Everything God does is a form of reaching out.
The Christian gospel is that this cycle has been broken.
I command you to do this (quoting Deut).

perlocutie.beoogd_effect: To motivate the congregation toward mission by reframing it as a participation in God's already-accomplished victory.
perlocutie.pneumatologisch_bewustzijn: Moderate; mentions the Spirit in the context of Acts 1:8 and 'heavenly grace,' but the Spirit's role in the preaching event itself is implicit.

voorbeelden: The word mission comes from a Latin root.
We were all unfortunate.
This is human nature.
Be steadfast, immovable.
You shall remember that you were a slave.
Never underestimate the power.
I remember with great vividness.
I never really trusted the Byrd Machine after that.
Thanks be to God.
He who believes in me will also do the works that I do.
God's power is present in our small actions.
Resurrection power is now given to the Christian community.
commissieven.kwaliteit: The promises are largely quoted from Scripture rather than directly formulated as a personal 'I promise you' from the preacher.

voorbeelden: In Christ, all of the 'theys' have become 'us'.
The cycle has been broken.
Christ is risen, we are risen!
declaratieven.autoriteit: The preacher speaks with apostolic authority, especially when declaring the status of the 'unfortunates' as redeemed.

indicatoren: Extensive historical narrative about the Byrd Machine.
Sociological analysis of the Columbine massacre.
constatief_surplus_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer is well-informed and intellectually convinced, but remains a spectator of God's history rather than a direct participant in a current event.

missende_elementen: Direct address of the promise ('I tell you today...')
performatief_deficit_analyse.effect_op_hoorder: The hearer might feel the 'ought' (directive) without feeling the 'is' (declarative) as a personal reality.

toezegging_check.kwaliteit_toezeggen: Strong scriptural grounding, but often framed as 'The Gospel is...' rather than 'I announce to you...'
voorbeelden: This Resurrection power is now given to the Christian community.
He who believes in me will also do the works that I do.

tweede_persoon.gebruik: Direct address mainly in the context of quoting Scripture (Deuteronomy).
tweede_persoon.performatieve_context: Used to link the hearer to the identity of the 'slave in Egypt'.

derde_persoon.gebruik: Describing God, the Byrd Machine, the Balkans, and Columbine.
derde_persoon.distantie_effect: Creates a narrative distance that requires a 'bridge' to the present.

tijdloos_present.gebruik: Theological definitions and general truths about human nature.

actueel_present.gebruik: The 'now' of the congregation's mission and the Easter season.

foutief_patroon.beschrijving: The sermon avoids pure moralism by grounding directives in the indicative.

sacramenteel_patroon.beschrijving: Assertive (God reached out) -> Declarative (The cycle is broken) -> Directive (Reach out).
voorbeelden: Because God has given us the victory... therefore... be steadfast.
sacramenteel_patroon.kwaliteit: The transition is logically sound but rhetorically more explanatory than 'event-like'.

voorbeelden_goede_verhouding: By reaching out to others, we recapitulate the prior outreach of God to us.

diagnostische_evaluatie.diagnose_toelichting: The sermon is deeply rooted in the Gospel as a message of comfort and victory, but it functions more as a 'testimony' and 'teaching' than a 'sacramental event' where the word itself does what it says.

sterke_punten.effect: Provides a solid foundation for Christian action.

zwakke_punten.tekstueel_bewijs: The long section on the Byrd Machine.
zwakke_punten.probleem: While engaging, it takes up space that could be used for direct performative address.

diagnostische_evaluatie.gebeuren_toelichting: The sermon 'happens' mostly in the final third where the Resurrection power is applied to the present congregation.
diagnostische_evaluatie.sacramentele_toelichting: The language describes the sacrament of the Word but rarely 'is' the sacrament in a declarative sense.

openbaringsleer.god_als_spreker: Implicitly, through the reading of the Word.
openbaringsleer.prediker_als_mandataris: The preacher acts as a witness/teacher more than a herald of a present decree.
tekstueel_bewijs: The Christian gospel is that this cycle has been broken.

pneumatologie.geest_rol_erkend: Yes, in the context of power for mission.
pneumatologie.perlocutie_theologie: Partially; the preacher trusts the 'heavenly grace' to make the congregation fruitful.
tekstueel_bewijs: shed upon us heavenly grace... that we on earth may fruitful be.

sacramentstheologie.preek_als_genademiddel: The sermon treats the Gospel as a means of grace, but the delivery is more informative than performative.
sacramentstheologie.epifanisch_taalgebruik: Moderate; the 'Adam, where are you?' section is highly epiphanic.
tekstueel_bewijs: This is God seeking after his lost son and lost daughter.

aanbevelingen.werkwoord_audit_samenvatting: High frequency of 'is/was' (assertive), low frequency of direct 'I/You' performatives.

specifieke_suggesties.huidige_formulering: The Christian gospel is that this cycle has been broken.
specifieke_suggesties.voorgestelde_revisie: Today, in the hearing of this Word, Christ breaks the cycle of hatred in you.
specifieke_suggesties.verschil: Moves from a fact about the world to an act upon the hearer.

toezegging_versterking.probleem: The promise is often 'about' God's power rather than 'delivering' God's power.
toezegging_versterking.suggestie: Use more Commissives in the first person singular (as God's representative).
voorbeeldzinnen: I promise you on the authority of Christ: your labor is not in vain.

adressering_verbetering.probleem: Too much time in the 3rd person (Byrd Machine, the Balkans).
adressering_verbetering.suggestie: Shorten the anecdotes and pivot faster to 'You, here at All Saints...'
voorbeeldzinnen: You are the ones God is reaching out to right now.

indicatief_imperatief_herstel.probleem: The balance is actually quite good.
indicatief_imperatief_herstel.suggestie: Maintain the current grounding but make the indicative more performative.

aanbevelingen.slotopmerking: A deeply theological and narratively engaging sermon that successfully avoids moralism, though it could gain 'event-character' by shifting from describing the Gospel to enacting it.

comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_schulz_von_thun: SAT reveals that the preacher isn't just 'sending a message' about mission, but attempting to 'commission' the hearer through the Word.
comparatieve_analyse.verschil_met_retoriek: The analysis shows the sermon's power isn't in the Byrd Machine story (rhetoric), but in the Declarative 'The cycle has been broken' (SAT).
comparatieve_analyse.unieke_inzichten_SAT: SAT highlights that the sermon's 'Outreach' theme is most effective when the preacher 'reaches out' to the hearer via the 2nd person performative.

kernzinnen_analyse.effectiviteit: High; creates an immediate sense of being addressed by God.
Very high; the theological pivot of the sermon.

appendices.notities: The sermon is a classic example of high-quality mainline preaching that is 'almost' sacramental but remains slightly tethered to the 'constative' mode of the lecture/essay.
